episode.description: Jon Jandai is a Thai organic farmer whose self-reliant way of living attracts people from around the world. He simplifies life with the question: "Life is easy, why make it difficult?"
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Andria Zafirakou, an art teacher in London, won the Global Teacher Prize 2018 and is using the prize money of $1 million to create a foundation to help provide arts to disadvantaged school children.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Acclaimed Japan-China expert and Harvard Professor Emeritus Ezra Vogel discusses the history, cultural connection, and relationship between the 2 nations, and suggests how they can forge closer ties.
episode.description: Acclaimed Japan-China expert and Harvard Professor Emeritus Ezra Vogel discussed the history, cultural connection and relationship between the 2 nations, and suggested how they can forge closer ties.
episode.subtitle: Japan-China Relations, an Outsider's Perspective: Ezra Vogel / Sociologist
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Professor at Harvard Graduate School of Education Todd Rose demystifies the century-old average-based systems in society and proposes design paradigms to embrace individuality and unique talents.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Madeline Stuart is a fashion model and entrepreneur with Down syndrome, traveling around the world with the support of her mother Rosanne. She breaks from conventional ways to open people's minds.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: In China, most visually impaired people become masseuses or masseurs, but the blind Dong Lina became a verbal artist. She presents her thoughts on the determination needed to overcome many obstacles.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Delia Ferreira Rubio represents an international NGO that aims to eliminate crimes such as bribery and embezzlement worldwide. How can we prevent corruption, which she says undermines our daily lives?
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Robert Riener founded the Cybathlon, a global contest spurring the development of robotic assistive devices for people with disabilities. What role can robotics play in creating a diverse society?
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Bart Roetert, co-founder of Instock, a restaurant in the Netherlands, has rescued 800,000 kilograms of food waste. He tells how to address food waste issues in an efficient and positive manner.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: NORA is the lead vocalist of Orquesta de la Luz, a world-famous salsa band from Japan. She speaks about her passion for music, and what she hopes to accomplish through her work with the group.
episode.description: NORA is the lead vocalist of Orquesta de la Luz, a world-famous salsa band from Japan. She speaks about her passion for music, and what she hopes to accomplish through her work with the group.
episode.subtitle: No Salsa, No Life: NORA / Singer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Sho Kitagawa plays the balalaika, a traditional Russian stringed musical instrument. He was the first person from outside Russia to win a prestigious Russian music competition.
episode.description: Sho Kitagawa plays the balalaika, a traditional Russian stringed musical instrument. He was the first person from outside Russia to win a prestigious Russian music competition.
episode.subtitle: A Three Generation Dream: Sho Kitagawa / Balalaika Player
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Noriaki Imai returned to Japan after a hostage ordeal in Iraq only to face harsh criticism, which made him a social recluse. Today, he supports young people who have similarly withdrawn from society.
episode.description: Noriaki Imai returned to Japan after a hostage ordeal in Iraq only to face harsh criticism, which made him a social recluse. Today, he supports young people who have similarly withdrawn from society.
episode.subtitle: Giving Young People Hope: Noriaki Imai / President, DxP
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Famous for its "Freak Cabaret" performances, the Ukrainian music and theater band Dakh Daughters sings about the harsh situation in Ukraine. Its vocalist explains the thoughts behind the lyrics.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Mitsuhiro Takasaki, President of Engineer Inc., developed innovative heavy-duty pliers that can remove stripped or rusted screws with ease. What is his manufacturing philosophy and business strategy?
episode.description: Mitsuhiro Takasaki, President of Engineer Inc., developed innovative heavy-duty pliers that can remove stripped or rusted screws with ease. What is his manufacturing philosophy and business strategy?
episode.subtitle: Removing Troublesome Screws: Mitsuhiro Takasaki / President, Engineer Inc.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Jokha Alharthi, the first Man Booker International Prize winner writing in Arabic, is also the first female Omani novelist translated into English. What message does her work have for today's world?
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Myanmar in southeast Asia suffers from a lack of safe drinking water. Hisafumi Shogi works with locals to develop the water supply infrastructure. He talks about the road so far and what lies ahead.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Koichiro Kobayashi has won gold at the Paraclimbing World Championships four times in a row. He works to help people who are visually impaired take up climbing. What does the sport mean to him?
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Terumo is a Japanese manufacturer of medical devices such as catheter-based solutions for the treatment of coronary arteries. Company CEO Sato Shinjiro talks about reducing the burden on patients.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Takeuchi Masahiko runs and funds a nonprofit that builds schools for the blind around the world. Takeuchi himself is visually impaired. We speak with him about his life's work.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Bartender Gokan Shingo was named 2017 International Bartender of the Year. He talks about the secrets behind his signature cocktails and what he loves about bar culture.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: For many foreigners living in Japan, the language barrier is hard to overcome. Choi Sungja is an advisor at a cafe where foreigners become chefs, communicating with Japan through their native cuisine.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Director Iwaisawa Kenji won the top prize at the Ottawa International Animation Festival for his 2019 feature film. He talks about his hand-drawn approach and what he hopes to convey through his work.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Yoshitake Shinsuke is one of Japan's best known children's book authors, the winner of multiple international prizes. He finds inspiration in aspects of kids' lives that grown-ups tend to ignore.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Hagiuda Megumi imports and sells African roses from Kenya as part of an effort to contribute to women's employment in the region. She talks about what roses mean to her, and what drives her.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Bernd Gaiser, a co-founder of Berlin CSD, talks about why he encourages coming out of the closet and how he came to set up a multi-generational housing project for those of any sexual orientation.
episode.description: Bernd Gaiser, a co-founder of Berlin CSD, talks about why he encourages coming out of the closet and how he came to set up a multi-generational housing project for those of any sexual orientation.
episode.subtitle: Taking Action Makes a Difference: Bernd Gaiser / Activist of the Lesbian and Gay Movement
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Extreme weather around the world is causing an increase in major natural disasters. We ask Ishii Mieko, a nurse who has worked in several disaster zones, about how to save lives.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Richard H. Kaszynski formed a global network to rapidly conduct clinical drug trials in order to fight against infectious disease pandemics. He talks about a promising drug candidate for COVID-19.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: When the COVID-19 pandemic hit Malaysia, Rashvin Singh and his team at his social enterprise wanted to make a difference and began producing face shields to help frontliners.
episode.description: When the Covid-19 pandemic hit Malaysia, Rashvin Singh and his team at his social enterprise wanted to make a difference and began producing face shields to help frontliners.
episode.subtitle: Making a Difference: Rashvin Singh / Co-Founder of Biji-Biji Initiative
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Minister Audrey Tang's IT measures against COVID-19 greatly contributed to Taiwan's successful containment of the virus. She is also a leading force behind Taiwan's digital democracy.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Fashion designer Morinaga Kunihiko creates technologically innovative styles that no one has ever seen before. He tells us what motivates his work, and discusses the untapped potential of clothing.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: As the coronavirus strikes the world, South Korea's corona prevention measures are recognized as a success. Professor Ki Moran, the chief of COVID-19 task force is leading the success with the government.
episode.description: As the coronavirus strikes the world, South Korea's corona prevention measures are recognized as a success. Professor Moran Ki, the chief of COVID-19 task force is leading the success with government.
episode.subtitle: The Story Behind COVID-19 Measures: Ki Moran / Professor, Department of Cancer Control and Population Health at the National Cancer Center
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Taavi Kotka of Estonia, an IT powerhouse with 99% of its government services available online, speaks on how engineering will shape our technological future.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Dominique Chen, known for his outstanding research in the field of information studies, talks about ways to achieve well-being through digital communications.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Earth Heir, a social enterprise in Malaysia is founded by Sasibai Kimis to empower the lives of marginalized communities, emphasizing on combining traditional craftsmanship with modern design.
episode.description: Earth Heir, a social enterprise in Malaysia is founded by Sasibai Kimis to empower the lives of marginalized communities, emphasizing on combining traditional craftsmanship with modern design.
episode.subtitle: Changing Perceptions: Sasibai Kimis / Founder of Earth Heir
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: With amazing economic growth in recent years, Rwanda has been pursuing a progressive ICT policy. The woman appointed Minister of ICT and Innovation at merely 35 talks about the future ICT offers.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Saengduean Chailert, the founder of Elephant Nature Park in northern Thailand, has devoted her life to caring for Asian elephants that were wounded while made to work as performance animals or in logging.
episode.description: Saengduean Chailert, founder of Elephant Nature Park in northern Thailand, has devoted her life to caring for Asian elephants that were wounded while made to work as performance animals or in logging.
episode.subtitle: All Life on Earth Is Equal: Saengduean Chailert / Founder of Save Elephant Foundation, Director of Elephant Nature Park
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Anoushka Shankar is a sitarist, composer and producer who has won many awards in the world music scene. She is the daughter of Indian musician Ravi Shankar. She is also a social activist and feminist.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Max Richter is one of the most successful composers in the contemporary music world. He has produced critically acclaimed albums of his own compositions, and also writes for films, ballet and opera.
episode.description: Max Richter is one of the most successful composers in the contemporary music world. He has produced critically acclaimed albums of his own compositions, and also writes for films, ballet, and opera.
episode.subtitle: Communicating With Music: Max Richter / Composer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Endo Ken is developing next-generation artificial limbs, including the world's best sports prosthetic and a robotic leg that reduces strain for those with disabilities. What is his vision for society?
episode.description: Endo Ken is developing next-generation artificial limbs, including the world's best sports prosthetic and a robotic leg that reduces strain for those with disabilities. What is his vision for society?
episode.subtitle: Giving the Joy of Running: Endo Ken / Prosthetic Leg Engineer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Director Ladj Ly's film "Les Misérables" was a Jury Prize winner in Cannes Film Festival 2019. He tells us how we can overcome racism and poverty as BLM expands in France.
episode.description: Director Ladj Ly's film "Les Miserables" was a Jury Prize winner in Cannes Film Festival 2019. He tells us how we can overcome racism and poverty as BLM expands in France.
episode.subtitle: The Real "Les Misérables" of Today: Ladj Ly / Film Director
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Lee Ayu Chuepa, founder of Akha Ama Coffee and a member of Thailand's Akha ethnic minority, provides high-quality coffee to global consumers while protecting the livelihood of his community's farmers.
episode.description: Lee Ayu Chuepa, founder of Akha Ama Coffee and a member of Thailand's Akha ethnic minority, provides high-quality coffee to global consumers while protecting the livelihood of his community's farmers.
episode.subtitle: Enriching People's Lives With Coffee: Lee Ayu Chuepa / Founder of Akha Ama Coffee, Social Entrepreneur
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: HARA is an illusionist who has performed live and on television in over 30 countries, winning numerous awards. We speak with him about how he strives to conjure up "magic that only I can do."
episode.description: HARA is an illusionist who has performed live and on television in over 30 countries, winning numerous awards. We speak with him about how he strives to conjure up "magic that only I can do."
episode.subtitle: Original Magic That Captivates the World: HARA / Illusionist
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Graphic designer Shimada Tamotsu was chosen to design the official logo for the 2025 World Exposition to be held in Osaka Prefecture, Japan. What is the concept behind the eye-catching design?
episode.description: Graphic designer Shimada Tamotsu was chosen to design the official logo for the 2025 World Exposition to be held in Osaka, Japan. What is the concept behind the eye-catching design?
episode.subtitle: Behind the Logo: Shimada Tamotsu / Graphic Designer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Londoner, Josie Naughton co-founded Help Refugees, a charity devoted to raising funds to help refugees and displaced people who are escaping war, persecution and poverty.
episode.description: Londoner, Josie Naughton co-founded Help Refugees, a charity devoted to raising funds to help refugees and displaced people who are escaping war, persecution and poverty.
episode.subtitle: The Forgotten Refugees: Josie Naughton / Co-founder & CEO Help Refugees
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Producer of hit musicals discusses how Broadway theaters should reopen safely and profitably in the COVID-19 era and respond to the Black Lives Matter movement by appealing to a more diverse audience.
episode.description: Producer of hit musicals discusses how Broadway theaters should reopen safely and profitably in the COVID-19 era and respond to the Black Lives Matter movement by appealing to a more diverse audience.
episode.subtitle: Bringing the Lights Back to Broadway: Yasuhiro Kawana / Theater Producer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Stella Jean has submitted action plans to the council to eliminate discrimination in the Italian fashion industry. In particular, she is struggling to give non-white youth a chance to get jobs.
episode.description: Stella Jean has submitted action plans to the council to eliminate discrimination in the Italian fashion industry. In particular, she is struggling to give non-white youth a chance to get jobs.
episode.subtitle: Building Bridges to Diversity: Stella Jean / Fashion Designer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: The bicycles painstakingly crafted by Konno Shinichi offer superior technology and design. Japanese cyclists love them, and they've won multiple awards at international trade shows.
episode.description: The bicycles painstakingly crafted by Konno Shinichi offer superior technology and design. Japanese cyclists love them, and they've won multiple awards at international trade shows.
episode.subtitle: Ideal Framing: Konno Shinichi / Bicycle Framebuilder
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: For former astronaut Chris Hadfield, life in self-isolation amid the pandemic is similar to that of an astronaut in space. He shares his tips on how to survive and thrive in the long-running pandemic.
episode.description: For former astronaut Chris Hadfield, life in self-isolation amid the pandemic is similar to that of an astronaut in space. He shares his tips on how to survive and thrive in the long-running pandemic.
episode.subtitle: Command Your Spaceship in Isolation: Chris Hadfield / Former Astronaut
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Sociology professor James Nolan warns of the danger to society of an unchecked technological mindset. His new book explores the complicity of doctors in covering up the dangers of the atom bomb.
episode.description: Sociology professor James Nolan warns of the danger to society of an unchecked technological mindset. His new book explores the complicity of doctors in covering up the dangers of the atom bomb.
episode.subtitle: Technology's Power to Shape Us: James Nolan / Professor of Sociology
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Dr. Claire Wardle is on a mission to help the global public understand the dangers of disinformation and misinformation, which have proliferated with the rise of social media and now the coronavirus.
episode.description: Dr. Claire Wardle is on a mission to help the global public understand the dangers of disinformation and misinformation, which have proliferated with the rise of social media and now the coronavirus.
episode.subtitle: The Fight Against Misinformation: Claire Wardle / Social Media Expert
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Yukari Suzuki has been working for reconciliation between the Dutch, Japanese and Indonesian. How can people transcend division through dialogue?
episode.description: Yukari Suzuki has been working for reconciliation between the Dutch, Japanese and Indonesian. How can people transcend division through dialogue?
episode.subtitle: Bridging the Division: Yukari Tangena Suzuki / Chairperson "The Foundation Dialogue Netherlands-Japan-Indonesia"
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Nodoka Okisawa is one of the world's most buzzed-about young conductors. In 2019 she won the prestigious International Besançon Competition. We speak to her about her musical passions.
episode.description: Nodoka Okisawa is one of the world's most buzzed-about young conductors. In 2019 she won the prestigious International Besancon Competition. We speak to her about her musical passions.
episode.subtitle: Musical Direction: Nodoka Okisawa / Conductor
episode.title: Direct Talk
